segments.text: Have you ever been in an earthquake ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I experienced one when I was in Tokyo once . The tremors only lasted a few seconds though and then it was over .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you know where it measured on the Richter scale ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't remember , but it wasn't very serious . Have you ever been in an earthquake ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , but I was in quite a few tornados when I was younger .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm from the plains of the Midwest . It's a prime location for tornadoes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Did your house ever get damaged from the winds ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Most of the time we were lucky , but once a tree from our front yard was ripped out by its roots and ended up in our living room .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wow , that must have really been scary .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Actually , some of my fon best memories of my childhood were of spending time with my family in the basement waiting for the tornados to pass .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Have you ever experiences a flood ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , but my father's car was destroyed in a flood once . It actually happened the day after he bought the car !
segments.speaker: S1
